reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Centally located next to new shopping centre nearing completion. Easy to find just off ring road. Parking was in hotel car park which only has a small number of spaces, but there is a council pay and display car park 50 yards away.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reception was quick and polite, hotel has key card entry on corridor access as well as room, also main entrance after 10pm which adds to security.
reviews.title: basic - but does what t says on the tin

reviews.text: Double room was slightly smaller than other TLs I have stayed at, bathroom only had shower but this was a good size. The room overall was clean and tidy considering day to day wear and tear.
reviews.title: well located for city break, biz or last minute stay over

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was some noise from our room but it was at end nearest ring road and next to building site of new shopping centre so some work noise after 7.45am.
reviews.title: A modern, well located Travelodge....

reviews.text: Overall decent budget hotel if you are visiting Wakefield.
reviews.title: difficult to find, difficult to park, easy on the wallet though

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is well located for Wakefield Town Centre shopping and Dining. The Car Park is a problem though with more cars parked outside than in their car park during our visit. Cars parked in the College Car Park need to be moved by 8am on days the college is open. This will mean extra street parking charges as there is no other free parking nearby.
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room we had was very clean and had a nice flat screen TV.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As previously mentioned the doors are noisy and you would certainly not want a room near one of the floor access doors, unless you're a heavy sleeper, or don't mind interupted sleep.
reviews.title: Great central location
Good Location - But Has It's Problems
reviews.text: Our room was opposite the pub, but we did not have the windows open and heard no noise from it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We tried the China Wok mentioned in a previous review as the Bejing Dragon restaurant is now closed. The food was excellent, but they restrict your ordering too much at one time to cut waste. We ordered 5 dishes to start with (didn't allow a 6th one as they were worried we wouldn't eat it). Then once we had almost finished we ordered 3 more. The menu was still £9.50, but prawns were £1 extra per dish ordered.
reviews.title: Worst Hotel EVER!

reviews.text: We stayed in this travelodge for a school half term two night break. The booking was made in one of the travelodge sales, so only cost £30 in total. The room was modern and spacious, the furniture was comfortable. The children were impressed to find cbeebies on the new wall mounted flat screen tv.
reviews.title: Excellent value in a comfortable, clean and spacious room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wakefield was a good base for visiting local attractions like the Yorkshire Sculpture Park, National Mining Museum and Leeds, which was a 15 minute train journey from the station in Wakefield. We walked to the station through the town centre, this took about 15 minutes.
reviews.title: very clean but basic rooms

reviews.text: We had a meal at an excellent Chinese restaurant, China Wok, just 2 minutes walk from the hotel on the road into the town centre, which offered a £9.50 menu where you could order from a wide selection of dishes on the menu. The food was delicious, and the staff friendly and helpful with my child who has a food allergy. We also ate at Fresh and Tasty Sandwich Bar, a cafe just next door to the hotel which offered a really good full English breakfast for £3, and also offered a full range of rolls to take out. This cafe is under new management, and is open from 7am Mon to Fri, and 7.30am on Sat.
reviews.title: Great location clean place to stay

reviews.text: This is the best Travelodge I have ever stayed in. I use Travelodge regularly as they offer very good room rates via the internet and found this the best by far. It was a little noisy on the saturday night due to noise from the pub across from the hotel but this is to be expected for a city centre hotel. The staff on duty who I saw were all very polite and helpful. The rooms are basic as in all Travelodges but these were very clean and modern rooms also thet seemed a little bigger than normal rooms I have stayed in before.
reviews.title: Excellent Central Location & Bargain Price 4 Girls Nite Out!

likes.disliked: — Nothing, its ideal for what it is!!
